result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Michael L. Mara in court.  Attorney Christopher W Dyer appeared by video for Michael L. Mara.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Discussion re: scheduling
Motion hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
10/06/22 D.A. ltr. RE: Rescheduling - Michael Mara
Motion hearing on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:02 AM Case called - appearances stated.
 Defendant Michael L. Mara in court.  Attorney Christopher W Dyer appeared by video for Michael L. Mara.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Dyer is heard on status of this case - inquires whether state is going to offer video instead of in person testimony
Atty. Steiner is heard - at this time, the State does plan to have direct exam of the witness.
Atty Dyer inquires whether state plans to provide prior CPS records - response by Atty. Steiner, within a week or so can advise Atty. Dyer of what he has found
Court passes this case

recalled 10:23 AM
Discussion re scheduling

Motion hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:00 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael L. Mara in court.  Attorney Christopher W Dyer appeared by phone for Michael L. Mara.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     D.A. just filed an information without deviation from the complaint.  
     Atty. Dyer asks for a status conference about 60 days out.
     Def. waives reading of the Information; enters a not guilty plea.
     Court schedules status hearing; bond is to continue.
     Court concludes at 10:07 a.m.
Status hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on August 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:27 PM Case called - appearances stated
Defendant Michael L. Mara in court.  Attorney Christopher W Dyer in court for Michael L. Mara.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

1W - ASHLEY ERICKSON -Sworn
Exam. by Atty. Steiner
Cross Exam. by Atty. Dyer

Atty. Steiner moves for bind over
Atty. Dyer reserves any argument

Court finds probable cause and binds def. over
Arraignment scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No intentional contact with children under the age of 13.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael L. Mara
Current: 17450 Martin Road, Boscobel, WI 53805 United States  (Effective: 04-25-2022)
Prior: 1306 S 6th Street, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

1:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael L. Mara in court.  Attorney Christopher W Dyer appeared by video for Michael L. Mara.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Def. updates the court on his new address.  Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each of the three counts.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
     D.A. requests a signature bond; conditions of no contact with R.R.S. and no unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 13.  Atty. Dyer comments; feels no contact request is too vague.  D.A. comments; adds language of no unsupervised contact with children under the age of 13 other than incidental contact.  Atty. Dyer satisfied with that addition.
     Court orders $1,000 signature bond, no intentional contact with children under the age of 13, with other standard rules of bond.
     Court concludes at 1:14 p.m.
     No objection to prelim beyond the 20 days; prelim set for June 17.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on May 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
